Posted By: TheLionsMane (5/26/2011 8:25:15 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: The main problem with using both is that aggro wants to be fast, and those cards are rather costly, limiting the amount of deck space you can devote to 5 mana cards. You could do both, but this could end up just slowing your deck down, rather than giving the extra oomph needed to get the last bit of damage through. Trust me, you don't want to draw 2-3 5 mana cards in your opening hand if you're playing aggro, and you want to avoid mulligans if at all possible. I wouldn't devote more than 4 slots for 5 mana cards in an aggro deck, if even that. Agrus is great, and prior to the Liege, he probably was the best card for R/W decks out there. Though he does shine if you can do more than one attack in a turn. (+2/+2 on first attack, +4/+4 on second)
posts.html:

Trust me, you don't want to draw 2-3 5 mana cards in your opening hand if you're playing aggro, and you want to avoid mulligans if at all possible. I wouldn't devote more than 4 slots for 5 mana cards in an aggro deck, if even that. Agrus is great, and prior to the Liege, he probably was the best card for R/W decks out there. Though he does shine if you can do more than one attack in a turn. (+2/+2 on first attack, +4/+4 on second)

posts.post_content: Agrus Kos is one of the coolest magic characters ever! Agrus is the main character in the Ravnica Novels, and after reading all of them I have attained a deeper understanding of him and his card. The mechanic of this card is amazing, especially if the right creatures are out. For example if everything that you control is red-white then everyone of your creatures gets a free +2/+2 bonus, now thats justice.

posts.post_content: Why does everyone say "I'd use Balefire Liege"? You can use both. Agrus can be a general balefire liege can't. In non-EDH stack 4 balefire lieges and play Agrus and Razia together to win the game. Balefire liege doesn't benefit from his own abiity like Agrus does, making Agrus a much better attacker. And to top it all off Agrus is the best boros general (Unless you run enough artifacts against a low artifact destrcution deck to make Jor Ka. better). As a bonus you can always use Hellkite charger and hit for +2/+0 for all reds and +0/+2 for all whites that then stacks and becomes +4/+0 for reds and +0/+4 for all whites until you run out of mana.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: The main problem with using both is that aggro wants to be fast, and those cards are rather costly, limiting the amount of deck space you can devote to 5 mana cards. You could do both, but this could end up just slowing your deck down, rather than giving the extra oomph needed to get the last bit of damage through. Trust me, you don't want to draw 2-3 5 mana cards in your opening hand if you're playing aggro, and you want to avoid mulligans if at all possible. I wouldn't devote more than 4 slots for 5 mana cards in an aggro deck, if even that. Agrus is great, and prior to the Liege, he probably was the best card for R/W decks out there. Though he does shine if you can do more than one attack in a turn. (+2/+2 on first attack, +4/+4 on second)
